thread.title: FL Sup. Court OKs ballot language on solar amendment
thread.title_full: FL Sup. Court OKs ballot language on solar amendment

title: FL Sup. Court OKs ballot language on solar amendment
text:
FL Sup. Court OKs ballot language on solar amendment Associated Press, AP 1:39 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 Cochin, India is building the first 100% solar-powered airport (Photo: Photo credit: ChristofferRiemer) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) - A group seeking a constitutional amendment to promote solar energy cleared one hurdle but still has a long way to go to make Florida's ballot next year. 
The Supreme Court ruled Thursday that the ballot summary for the proposed amendment is good. Attorney General Pam Bondi asked the court to strike it down, saying it was vague and misleading. 
A coalition called Floridians for Solar Choice is collecting signatures to put their proposal on next year's ballot. It would prevent the state from regulating small, private solar companies that provide up to two megawatts of solar energy to properties that border them. 
But the group still needs about 500,000 of the 683,149 voter signatures to make the ballot. The deadline to collect them is Feb. 1. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1RZ01hl TOP VIDEOS
